bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 6, 1879

div1.p: Reed's trip to Fort Apache, Arizona continues. He describes a river crossing. Col. Compton, post commander, travels out to meet Reed and Mrs. Compton.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, May 6, 1879

opener.dateline: Laguna, Valencia Co. New Mexico, May 6th 1879.

div1.p:
My last postal postal
was written Monday morning the 4th, at Albuquer-
-que. We left that charming town with its
too charming Hotel (which I dare say my
little darling hasn't forgotten) at 7 o'clock a.m.
and by 8 o'clock we were across the Rio Grande.
The river was much higher than when you
crossed - we took ambulance & all the mules
at one trip- The plagued mules seemed to think
that they were going to be upset into the
water & accordingly made perfect fools of
themselves- Mrs. C. was very much frightened,
but we got across safely with the usual am't
of Mexican yelling & dancing around the Boat.
We had a long slow pull from the Rio Grande
to the Rio Puerco, where the fat gentleman re-
sides who laughed so much at seeing Law-
-rence tied- We got there at 3 a.m. & expec-
-ted to meet the Colonel- He had written a
letter which Mrs. C. got at Albuquerque, saying that
he had arrived at McCarthy's & would leave his team
& push on the best way he could. Mrs. C. was very
much disappointed at not finding him, but at
10 P. M., while I was walking about in the bright
moonlight, thinking of you, my darling & little baby
son, who should rise up & salute me but Col.
C. He had started from El Rito at 7.30 P. M. & ride
had ridden from that place to Rio Puerco in just 2 hours
& a half- distance 28 miles- He expected to go on &
meet us at Albuquerque about 11 P. M. Of course Mrs.
C. was delighted & happy- Yesterday morning, we left Puerco
at 7 o'clock & came direct to this point without
stopping at El Rito, the place where the mule was
sick. Laguna is the place where the missionary resides,
you will remember. We are stopping with him- Had a
good supper & a good night's rest. Am writing to
you, sweet little love, before breakfast, & will mail
this to-day at Cubero- We go to-day to McCarthy's
& back by the same old route we came, We have been
coming from the R.R. just 10 days yesterday - have made
300 miles - will reach Apache in 8 more days - by the 13th-
The mail route the Col. tells me is alright- will write you to-mor-
row if there is an office, but rather think we will leave the mail route
to-day- Love to all- Be a darling little wife & enjoy yourself all you can-
a kiss for baby-
